Save your beautiful farmers’ market berries for dessert and use the frozen stuff here instead.Ingredients4 servings2Medjool dates, pitted2cups coconut water1cup cashews1cup fresh or frozen blueberries⅓cup plain whole-milk Greek yogurt1Tbsp. fresh lime juiceLarge pinch of kosher saltPreparationPurée dates, coconut water, cashews, blueberries, yogurt, lime juice, salt, and 2 cups ice in a blender until smooth.How would you rate Blueberry, Lime, and Cashew Smoothies?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (4)Back to TopTriangleThis smoothie is horrible 
No taste and the aftertaste of coconut water And lime makes me gag Julie HLos Angeles 4/21/2021I love this smoothie! The lime really makes a difference. Soaking the cashews overnight helps to blend them more smoothly.Kiran12/15/2020Oh my goodness! This was by far one of the best smoothies that I've had. I am a big blueberry and cashew fan, so it was perfect for me. Prep time was super fast and it's a healthy smoothie. Can't ask for more than that! Thanks for the recipe .Showtime813Florida10/13/2020This was good but very cashew forward.  Next time we'll try using only half the cashews

We have been cooking and eating recipes from the Bon Appetit healthyish menu for the past year.
